Cyber Monday sales are starting, and that means it’s one of the best times of year to pick up a new TV. If you’ve been hoping to grab a new big screen but aren’t sure which one to get, allow us to separate the junk deals from the ones worth your time. Below we’ve rounded up the best Cyber Monday TV deals we could find so far, with discounts on high-end OLEDs and budget-friendly options from Samsung, LG, Sony, Hisense and more.

## Best Cyber Monday TV deals: Under $500

[**Hisense U65QF (55-inch) for $398 at Amazon ($402 off MSRP)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWG3BL1&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Hisense+U65QF+%2855-inch%29+for+%24398+at+Amazon+%28%24402+off+MSRP%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdHM0JMMS9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAbKpPgn3VSkG3x4ZYqhRch8EZqyOx8xnWFu4LNdHnBS3&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWG3BL1%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): The U65QF is another entry-level LED TV with [generally](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/hisense-65u65qf) [positive](https://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/hisense/u65qf) [reviews](https://www.techradar.com/televisions/hisense-u65qf-review). Most feedback around the web suggests that it can’t match the QM6K in terms of contrast, gaming features and overall accuracy, so TCL’s model should be a better buy for most. This iteration also uses Amazon’s Fire TV platform instead of the [cleaner Google TV](https://www.engadget.com/entertainment/streaming/google-tv-streamer-review-a-great-side-piece-for-your-tv-with-a-dash-of-smart-home-chops-and-inessential-ai-160034550.html). It can achieve a higher peak brightness, however, so it’s worth considering if you get particularly bad glare in your living room. This is the lowest price we’ve seen for the 55-inch model, but the 65-inch ([$548](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYW81FWH&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24548&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVc4MUZXSC9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAaoC8XCYmAemodRaC0qmqZgDXWpV18-CWPxs-ZzWp3EV&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYW81FWH%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)), 75-inch ([$748](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWNQMQJ&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24748&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdOUU1RSi9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAdTKmW5ruUpBlC3hxkEMnFE7iQ8mEmsgXqsIvFRQA6AC&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWNQMQJ%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) and 85-inch ([$890](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWZW2VQ&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24890&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdaVzJWUS9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAbH4yrHicIGTIOjN0WbGKBU003H-yos4uHQqEevhhFx2&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWZW2VQ%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) models are also at all-time lows. ## Best Cyber Monday TV deals: Between $500 and $1,000

[**LG B5 (48-inch) for $550 at Best Buy ($770 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=LG+B5+%2848-inch%29+for+%24550+at+Best+Buy+%28%24770+off%29&&signature=AQAAAVi5CV9RJGq2Wt_GEcCSrDtiTZa7WqSspn3qimVuuzIT&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Flg-48-class-b5-series-oled-ai-4k-uhd-smart-webos-tv-2025%2FJJ8VPZTK9F%2Fsku%2F6635292): The B5 is LG’s entry-level OLED TV for 2025. It gets you the core benefits of any OLED TV — excellent contrast, wide viewing angles, smooth motion and so on — but it can’t get as bright as the higher-end [LG C5](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYQF1Q3Z&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=LG+C5&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL0xHLVVwc2NhbGluZy1GaWxtbWFrZXItT3JjaGVzdHJhLU9MRUQ2NUM1UFVBL2RwL0IwRFlRRjFRM1o_&signature=AQAAATXemZ1MROP2lTTLjv7WF3n9RFrbaVtmqeGTUjKf1nFM&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FLG-Upscaling-Filmmaker-Orchestra-OLED65C5PUA%2Fdp%2FB0DYQF1Q3Z), nor does it look quite as colorful. It’s technically limited to a 120Hz refresh rate instead of 144Hz, too, though that isn’t a big deal unless you plan to play PC games on your TV. This deal is within $20 of the all-time low we saw on Black Friday. The [55-inch model](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0FFXN5PN9&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=55-inch+model&&signature=AQAAATRlQpj2KyEH7rRpoxatESTC4uSEHi6_bc43YktmwDNd&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FLG-Upscaling-Filmmaker-Orchestra-OLED65B5PUA-AUSZ%2Fdp%2FB0FFXN5PN9) is on sale for a low of $897 as well. Also at [LG](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=472a467b-5d76-4e49-b1e8-d1e77258dd8e&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=LG+Electronics&linkText=LG&&signature=AQAAAe68yulcs-X1gXG3IYk7dPd7jmgHISnmLZ9rUSZNzDRE&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lg.com%2Fus%2Ftvs%2Flg-oled55b5pua-oled-4k-tv).

[**Hisense U75QG (55-inch) for $498 at Amazon ($416 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F22F1VLH&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Hisense+U75QG+%2855-inch%29+for+%24498+at+Amazon+%28%24416+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBGMjJGMVZMSC9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAdekMFjYxrpQhzNOZDg2hK9oC39pERva_UhfDEj7Si3e&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0F22F1VLH%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): The Hisense U75QG is a close competitor to the QM7K. Its main advantage is that it can get much brighter than TCL’s model, which can make HDR content look more dynamic. This set also comes with four HDMI 2.1 ports instead of two, which is nice for those with multiple game consoles and a soundbar. That said, [some reviews](https://www.rtings.com/tv/tools/compare/tcl-qm7k-vs-hisense-u75qg/88608/96104) say its contrast falls short of the QM7K and that it can make HDR content _too_ bright to be fully accurate. It also suffers from more noticeable motion blur, which means it's not the best choice for fast-paced games. So you may only want to grab it if you’re determined to stay in this price range and have your TV in an especially bright room. Nevertheless, this is a new low for the 55-inch set. The same goes for the 65-inch ([$748](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24748&&signature=AQAAAYlFEBRPSU-xo8HQenUbpi_V0encPJVzQ3kHZj6udyAn&gcReferrer=http%3A%2F%2Famazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0F1DWQKXC%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) and 75-inch ([$998](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F1DSS7XV&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24998&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBGMURTUzdYVi9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAfcWf8B7TMv7VJbnTb61x7ZyBzbTpW7qMznaMmNkXAMC&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0F1DSS7XV%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) models. Instead, you’d buy one if care about your TV’s aesthetic above all else, since they’re designed to look like a [framed piece of wall art](https://www.engadget.com/samsung-the-frame-tv-irl-153546368.html). This set also has a matte screen finish, so it holds up well against glare and direct reflections. This discount drops the 55-inch version to a new all-time low. Just note that we’re highlighting the 2024 model; [this year’s edition](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DXN3QKS8&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=this+year%E2%80%99s+edition&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL1NhbXN1bmctNTUtSW5jaC1Qcm9jZXNzb3ItUGljdHVyZS1RdWFsaXR5L2RwL0IwRFhOM1FLUzg_&signature=AQAAAckQDT4wk4aRJe8W2yimh5lhnUjXSdkuWEjJuGMiIt_B&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FSamsung-55-Inch-Processor-Picture-Quality%2Fdp%2FB0DXN3QKS8) is also on sale for $98 more, but its panel still isn’t great the price, so we recommend saving as much cash as possible if you’re dead-set on buying one of these things. [universally](https://www.tomsguide.com/tvs/4k-tvs/samsung-s95f-oled-tv-review) [stellar](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=c813ae39-7d58-41cb-ac66-ad830606ceef&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=The+New+York+Times&linkText=stellar&&signature=AQAAAf20gd7Q3eWBFQ_NalerqdgsjgsLWbe9ygNEulLcOXJS&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2Fwirecutter%2Freviews%2Fbest-oled-tv%2F) [reviews](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=fc65353f-45dc-4cd0-89be-ac2071680abb&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=008db846-f091-4525-8182-b8f49a576daf&featureId=text-link&merchantName=WIRED&linkText=reviews&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy53aXJlZC5jb20vcmV2aWV3L3NhbXN1bmctczk1Zi8iLCJjb250ZW50VXVpZCI6IjAwOGRiODQ2LWYwOTEtNDUyNS04MTgyLWI4ZjQ5YTU3NmRhZiIsIm9yaWdpbmFsVXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cud2lyZWQuY29tL3Jldmlldy9zYW1zdW5nLXM5NWYvIn0&signature=AQAAAfDfp4t6O5oEwvdbFPm4FJpPZV9yEUantJs2IsfCgp2l&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Freview%2Fsamsung-s95f%2F) for being especially bright among OLED TVs while keeping the bold colors and contrast expected from a QD-OLED panel. That brightness, combined with the display’s matte finish, means it’s uniquely adept at fending off glare. It also has four HDMI 2.1 ports and a native 165Hz refresh rate for gaming. That said, there’s still no Dolby Vision HDR, and the matte coating means that black tones won’t look as deep in a bright room.
